desc: FAM46C is a protein that belongs to the group XXV nucleotidyltransferase superfamily and functions as a non-canonical poly(A) polymerase (PMID: 27060136). FAM46C expression has been shown to regulate cell cycle progression, cell differentiation, and regulation of RAS/MAPK signaling (PMID: 28341836). Loss-of-function FAM46C mutations and deletions have been identified in multiple myeloma, suggesting that FAM46C is a tumor suppressor (PMID: 21430775, 26282654, 20616218, 24434212). Mutations or deletions in FAM46C are associated with reduced overall survival in patients with multiple myleoma (PMID: 21994415). Rearrangements between MYC and FAM46C have also been found in patients with multiple myeloma (PMID: 24632883).

gene.name: family with sequence similarity 46 member C

desc: FAM46C encodes a protein of unknown function. Mutation and homozygous deletion of FAM46C are found in myeloma and are associated with reduced overall survival.
